ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It was a pretty good class. Professor Weir is by far the highlight, she's a really cool person that brings a lot of knowledge regarding her work in Northern Ireland. Not a great section leader, she kind of lets discussion drift randomly into the abyss sometimes. It's too bad she was only visiting. Overall, the class itself glossed over a lot of the basics of what one would expect a seminar on Terrorism to. Definitely a great course, very little work other than keeping up with the weekly readings, and you will come away with a lot of knowledge regarding such an important topic in the world today.

TAKE THIS CLASS. Professor Weir is amazing. The workload can be a lot, but if you are interested in this course take it. So worth it. You learn so much about terrorism (everything you think you know will be challenged). I walked away from this course feeling like I learned a lot. I loved it so much.
Great class a lot of reading and long reading summaries but really interesting !
If you are interested in Terrorism and want a general survey course in a small setting, yes.

This was an enlightening course. The readings were insightful and informative, and the professor had a great grasp on the material she was teaching. I enjoyed her flexibility in terms of paper topics, and I appreciated her commentary inside and outside of class. At the same time, I found the weekly reading summaries a waste of time, and I did not think she was an effective seminar/discussion leader. As a visiting professor, I think she would have benefitted immensely from some guidance on how Yale seminars are typically structured and taught.

I would highly recommend this class. It really takes political discourse to a whole new level of awareness and challenges some of the most deeply-seeded intuitions that we have about terrorism and terrorists. It is also very accommodating of individual interests.
